thread.title: Florida State focused on fighting through stunning loss to Georgia Tech
thread.title_full: Florida State focused on fighting through stunning loss to Georgia Tech - CBSSports.com

author: Eye on College Football staff
title: Florida State focused on fighting through stunning loss to Georgia Tech
text:
As Georgia Tech's Lance Austin returned a blocked field goal for a touchdown to beat Florida State 22-16 on Saturday , handing the Seminoles their first loss and dealing a potentially fatal blow to their College Football Playoff hopes, FSU coach Jimbo Fisher could only think one thing:
"When there is a blocked kick, you've got to cover," Fisher said, reflecting after Florida State's second loss in the past three seasons. "We talk about that all the time."
A Georgia Tech team which had lost five straight beat an FSU unit riding a 28-game ACC winning streak. It did not come through a dominant offensive or defenisve performance but rather a tremendous single play that gave the Yellow Jackets hopes of bowl eligibility while dashing the Noles' championship dreams in an instant.
If Florida State, which won the national title in 2013 and made the first CFP semifinals last season, harbors any hope of getting back into the big game, it will need lots of help. It can help its cause some on Nov. 7 when it goes head-to-head with ACC favorite Clemson, which destroyed Miami 58-0 on Saturday.
"We can't let one loss become two," Fisher said.

A stunned Jimbo Fisher leaves the field after Georgia Tech's shocker Saturday. (USATSI) 

Topics: Florida State Seminoles , NCAAF
